intro: Uncarina ankaranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a small, star-shaped berry that turns red when ripe. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it is often found in humid, forested areas.
